item.text: The Israelites had taken an oath in Mizpah, saying, “Not one of us will allow his daughter to marry a Benjaminite.”

So the <st data-num="05971" class="">people</st> <st data-num="0935" class="">came</st> to <st data-num="01008" class="">Bethel</st><n id="1" /> and <st data-num="03427" class="">sat</st> <st data-num="08033" class="">there</st> <st data-num="06440" class="">before</st> <st data-num="0430" class="">God</st> <st data-num="05704" class="">until</st> <st data-num="06153" class="">evening</st>, <st data-num="01058" class="">weeping</st> <st data-num="05375 06963">loudly</st> and <st data-num="01065 01419">uncontrollably</st>.<n id="2" />
They said, “Why, O Lord God of Israel, has this happened in Israel? An entire tribe has disappeared from Israel today!”
The next morning the people got up early and built an altar there. They offered up burnt sacrifices and tokens of peace.

The Israelites asked, “Who from all the Israelite tribes has not assembled before the Lord?” They had made a solemn oath that whoever did not assemble before the Lord at Mizpah must certainly be executed.

The <st data-num="01121 03478">Israelites</st> <st data-num="05162" class="">regretted</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">what had happened to</st><n id="1" /> their <st data-num="0251" class="">brother</st> <st data-num="01144" class="">Benjamin</st>. They <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>, “<st data-num="03117" class="">Today</st> we <st data-num="01438" class="">cut off</st> an <st data-num="0259" class="">entire</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="07626" class="">tribe</st> from <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st>!
How can we find wives for those who are left? After all, we took an oath in the Lord’s name not to give them our daughters as wives.”
So they asked, “Who from all the Israelite tribes did not assemble before the Lord at Mizpah?” Now it just so happened no one from Jabesh Gilead had come to the gathering.

When <st data-num="05971" class="">they</st> <st data-num="06485" class="">took roll call</st>,<n id="1" /> they <st data-num="02009" class="">noticed</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="0369 0376">none</st> of the <st data-num="03427" class="">inhabitants</st> of <st data-num="03003" class="">Jabesh</st> <st data-num="01568" class="">Gilead</st> were <st data-num="08033" class="">there</st>.

So the <st data-num="05712" class="">assembly</st> <st data-num="07971" class="">sent</st> <st data-num="08147 06240 0505">12,000</st> <st data-num="0376 01121 02428">capable warriors</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="08033">against Jabesh Gilead</st>.<n id="2" /> They <st data-num="06680 0559">commanded</st> them, “<st data-num="01980" class="">Go</st> and <st data-num="05221" class="">kill</st> with <st data-num="06310 02719">your swords</st><n id="3" /> the <st data-num="03427" class="">inhabitants</st> of <st data-num="03003" class="">Jabesh</st> <st data-num="01568" class="">Gilead</st>, including the <st data-num="0802" class="">women</st> and <st data-num="02945" class="">little children</st>.

<st data-num="06213">Do</st> <st data-num="02088 01696 0834">this</st>:<n id="1" /> <st data-num="02763" class="">Exterminate</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">every</st> <st data-num="02145" class="">male</st>, as well as <st data-num="03605" class="">every</st> <st data-num="0802" class="">woman</st> who has <st data-num="03045" class="">experienced</st> a <st data-num="02145" class="">man’s</st> <st data-num="04904" class="">bed</st>.<n id="2" /> But <st data-num="02421" class="">spare the lives</st> of any <st data-num="01330" class="">virgins</st>.” So they <st data-num="06213">did</st> <st data-num="03651">as instructed</st>.<n id="3" />
They found among the inhabitants of Jabesh Gilead 400 young girls who were virgins who had never been intimate with a man in bed. They brought them back to the camp at Shiloh in the land of Canaan.
The entire assembly sent messengers to the Benjaminites at the cliff of Rimmon and assured them they would not be harmed.
The Benjaminites returned at that time, and the Israelites gave to them the women they had spared from Jabesh Gilead. But there were not enough to go around.
The people regretted what had happened to Benjamin because the Lord had weakened the Israelite tribes.

The <st data-num="02205" class="">leaders</st><n id="1" /> of the <st data-num="05712" class="">assembly</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>, “<st data-num="04100" class="">How</st> can we <st data-num="06213" class="">find</st> <st data-num="0802" class="">wives</st> for those who are <st data-num="03498" class="">left</st>?<n id="2" /> <st data-num="03588" class="">After all</st>, the <st data-num="01144" class="">Benjaminite</st> <st data-num="0802" class="">women</st> have been <st data-num="08045" class="">wiped out</st>.

The<n id="1" /> <st data-num="06413" class="">remnant</st> of <st data-num="01144" class="">Benjamin</st> must be <st data-num="03425" class="">preserved</st>. An entire <st data-num="03478" class="">Israelite</st> <st data-num="07626" class="">tribe</st> should <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> be <st data-num="04229" class="">wiped out</st>.<n id="2" />

But <st data-num="0587" class="">we</st> <st data-num="03808 03201">can’t</st> <st data-num="05414" class="">allow</st> our <st data-num="0802 01323">daughters</st> <st data-num="05414" class="">to marry</st> them,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="03588" class="">for</st> the <st data-num="01121 03478">Israelites</st> <st data-num="07650" class="">took an oath</st>, <st data-num="0559" class="">saying</st>, ‘Whoever <st data-num="05414" class="">gives</st> a <st data-num="0802" class="">woman</st> to a <st data-num="01144" class="">Benjaminite</st> will be <st data-num="0779" class="">destroyed</st>.’<n id="2" />
However, there is an annual festival to the Lord in Shiloh, which is north of Bethel (east of the main road that goes up from Bethel to Shechem) and south of Lebonah.”

So they <st data-num="06680 0559">commanded</st> the <st data-num="01121 01144">Benjaminites</st>, “<st data-num="01980" class="">Go</st> <st data-num="0693" class="">hide</st> in the <st data-num="03754" class="">vineyards</st>,

and <st data-num="07200" class="">keep</st> your <st data-num="07200" class="">eyes open</st>.<n id="1" /> <st data-num="0518" class="">When</st> you <st data-num="02009" class="">see</st><n id="2" /> the <st data-num="01323" class="">daughters</st> of <st data-num="07887" class="">Shiloh</st> <st data-num="03318" class="">coming out</st> to <st data-num="02342" class="">dance</st> in the <st data-num="04246" class="">celebration</st>,<n id="3" /> <st data-num="03318" class="">jump out</st> <st data-num="04480" class="">from</st> the <st data-num="03754" class="">vineyards</st>. <st data-num="0376" class="">Each one</st> of you, <st data-num="02414" class="">catch</st> yourself a <st data-num="0802" class="">wife</st> from among the <st data-num="01323" class="">daughters</st> of <st data-num="07887" class="">Shiloh</st> and then <st data-num="01980" class="">go</st> home to the <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st> of <st data-num="01144" class="">Benjamin</st>.

When their fathers or brothers come and protest to us, we’ll say to them, ‘Do us a favor and let them be, for we could not get each one a wife through battle. Don’t worry about breaking your oath! You would only be guilty if you had voluntarily given them wives.’”
The Benjaminites did as instructed. They abducted 200 of the dancing girls to be their wives. They went home to their own territory, rebuilt their cities, and settled down.

<st data-num="06256 01931">Then</st> the <st data-num="01121 03478">Israelites</st> <st data-num="01980" class="">dispersed</st> from <st data-num="08033" class="">there</st> to their <st data-num="0376" class="">respective</st> <st data-num="07626" class="">tribal</st> and <st data-num="04940" class="">clan</st> <st data-num="07626 04940">territories</st>. <st data-num="0376" class="">Each</st> <st data-num="03318" class="">went</st> from <st data-num="08033" class="">there</st> to his own <st data-num="05159" class="">property</st>.<n id="1" />
In those days Israel had no king. Each man did what he considered to be right.
